nexttext:
where $\gamma > 0$ is the Zipf parameter.

The caches of type$-i$ have cache memory size $K_i \geq 1$, $i = 1, \dots, L$. For the content placement problem, we consider a probabilistic model. The content is independently placed in the cache memories according to the same distribution. This makes the content stored in the caches be i.i.d. subsets of $\mathcal{C}$. We denote the probability that the content $c_j$ is stored at a type$-i$ cache as
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a_{j}=\frac{j^{-\gamma}}{\sum_{j=1}^{J}j^{-\gamma}}," display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>γ</mi></mrow></msup><mrow><msubsup><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>J</mi></msubsup><msup><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>γ</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext:
where $\gamma > 0$ is the Zipf parameter.

The caches of type$-i$ have cache memory size $K_i \geq 1$, $i = 1, \dots, L$. For the content placement problem, we consider a probabilistic model. The content is independently placed in the cache memories according to the same distribution. This makes the content stored in the caches be i.i.d. subsets of $\mathcal{C}$. We denote the probability that the content $c_j$ is stored at a type$-i$ cache as
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E2.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="b_{j}^{(i)}:=\mathbb{P}\left(c_{j}\text{ stored in type$-i$ cache}\right)," display="block"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi>b</mi><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>i</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>:=</mo><mrow><mi>ℙ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>c</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mtext> stored in type</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>i</mi></mrow><mtext> cache</mtext></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

}^{(1)})^{n_{1}}p_{n_{1}}^{(1)}q(j,n_{1})," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>𝒃</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>J</mi></munderover><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></munderover><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msubsup><mi>b</mi><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>j</mi><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext>if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>ν</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></munderover></mstyle><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo columnalign="left"><mrow><mtext>otherwise</mtext><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable><mi/></mrow></mrow></math>

nexttext: and $\bar{\nu}$ can be obtained as the unique solution to the additional constraint
prevtext: where $\phi(\bar{\nu})$ is the solution over $b^{(1)}_j$ of
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E14.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="a_{j}\sum_{n_{1}=0}^{\infty}n_{1}(1-b_{j}^{(1)})^{n_{1}-1}p_{n_{1}}^{(1)}q(j,n%
_{1})=\bar{\nu}," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></munderover><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msubsup><mi>b</mi><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>j</mi><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>ν</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: and $\bar{\nu}$ can be obtained as the unique solution to the additional constraint
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E15.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\bar{b}_{1}^{(1)}+\dots+\bar{b}_{J}^{(1)}=K_{1}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mover accent="true"><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mover accent="true"><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mi>J</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: which, when insterted into \eqref{kkt6}, gives

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E16.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\bar{\omega}_{j}=\bar{b}_{j}^{(1)}\left[a_{j}\sum_{n_{1}=0}^{\infty}n_{1}(1-b_%
{j}^{(1)})^{n_{1}-1}p_{n_{1}}^{(1)}q(j,n_{1})-\bar{\nu}\right]," display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>ω</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mover accent="true"><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></munderover><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msubsup><mi>b</mi><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>j</mi><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>ν</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

\infty}n_{1}(1-b_{j}^{(1)})^{n_{1}-1}p_{n_{1}}^{(1)}q(j,n_{1})\right]=\bar{\nu}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mover accent="true"><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msubsup><mover accent="true"><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></munderover><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msubsup><mi>b</mi><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>j</mi><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>ν</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: Since we know that $0 \leq b_j^{(i)} \leq 1$, this implies that

{(1)}q(j,n_{1})." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>ν</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></munderover><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msubsup><mi>b</mi><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>j</mi><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: If $\bar{\nu} < a_j p_{1}^{(1)}q(j, 1)$, we have

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex8.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle\bar{\nu}\in\left[a_{j}p_{1}^{(1)}q(j,1),\text{ }a_{j}\sum_{n_{1}%
=0}^{\infty}n_{1}p_{n_{1}}^{(1)}q(j,n_{1})\right]." display="inline"><mrow><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>ν</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mo>∈</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>j</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></munderover></mstyle><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>j</mi><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: Thus, from \eqref{kkt6}, we have $\bar{b}_j^{(1)} = 1$. Similarly, if $\bar{\nu} > a_j \sum_{n_1=0}^{\infty} n_1 p_{n_1}^{(1)} q(j, n_1)$, we have
prevtext: If $\bar{\nu} < a_j p_{1}^{(1)}q(j, 1)$, we have
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex9.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\bar{\omega}_{j}=\bar{\lambda}_{j}+a_{j}\sum_{n_{1}=0}^{\infty}n_{1}(1-b_{j}^{%
(1)})^{n_{1}-1}p_{n_{1}}^{(1)}q(j,n_{1})-\bar{\nu}>0." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>ω</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>λ</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>+</mo><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></munderover><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msubsup><mi>b</mi><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>j</mi><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>ν</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: Thus, from \eqref{kkt6}, we have $\bar{b}_j^{(1)} = 1$. Similarly, if $\bar{\nu} > a_j \sum_{n_1=0}^{\infty} n_1 p_{n_1}^{(1)} q(j, n_1)$, we have
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex10.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\bar{\lambda}_{j}=\bar{\omega}_{j}+\bar{\nu}-a_{j}\sum_{n_{1}=0}^{\infty}n_{1}%
(1-b_{j}^{(1)})^{n_{1}-1}p_{n_{1}}^{(1)}q(j,n_{1})>0." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>λ</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>ω</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>+</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>ν</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></munderover><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msubsup><mi>b</mi><mi>j</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>q</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>j</mi><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: The user is covered by $n_i$ type$-i$ caches and distribution of the different type of caches is independent of each other. Therefore, the total coverage distribution probability mass function $p_{\bm{n}}$ will be the product of individual probability distributions
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex11.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle p_{n_{i}}^{(i)}" display="inline"><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>i</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex11.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle=P(\text{$n_{i}$ type$-i$ caches within radius $r$})" display="inline"><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mtext> type</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>i</mi></mrow><mtext> caches within radius </mtext><mi>r</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E18.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle=\frac{t_{i}^{n_{i}}}{n_{i}!}e^{-t_{i}}." display="inline"><mrow><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msubsup><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></msubsup><mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo lspace="0pt" rspace="3.5pt">!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: The user is covered by $n_i$ type$-i$ caches and distribution of the different type of caches is independent of each other. Therefore, the total coverage distribution probability mass function $p_{\bm{n}}$ will be the product of individual probability distributions
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E19.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="p_{\bm{n}}=p_{n_{1}}^{(1)}p_{n_{2}}^{(2)}\dots p_{n_{L}}^{(L)}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>p</mi><mi>𝒏</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>n</mi><mi>L</mi></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: and
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex12.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="P\left(\bm{\mathcal{N}}_{2}^{L}=\bm{n}_{2}^{L}|N_{1}=0\right)=\left\{\begin{%
array}[]{rl}0&\text{if }\max\{\bm{n}_{2}^{L}\}>0,\\
1&\text{if }\max\{\bm{n}_{2}^{L}\}=0,\end{array}\right." display="block"><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝓝</mi><mn>2</mn><mi>L</mi></msubsup><mo>=</mo><msubsup><mi>𝒏</mi><mn>2</mn><mi>L</mi></msubsup><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="right"><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext>if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>max</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><msubsup><mi>𝒏</mi><mn>2</mn><mi>L</mi></msubsup><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="right"><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext>if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>max</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><msubsup><mi>𝒏</mi><mn>2</mn><mi>L</mi></msubsup><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mrow></math>

prevtext: and
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex13.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="P\left(\bm{\mathcal{N}}_{2}^{L}=\bm{n}_{2}^{L}|N_{1}=n_{1}\right)=\left\{%
\begin{array}[]{rl}0&\text{if }\sum_{l=2}^{L}n_{l}\neq(M-n_{1})^{+},\\
1&\text{if }\sum_{l=2}^{L}n_{l}=(M-n_{1})^{+},\end{array}\right." display="block"><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝓝</mi><mn>2</mn><mi>L</mi></msubsup><mo>=</mo><msubsup><mi>𝒏</mi><mn>2</mn><mi>L</mi></msubsup><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="right"><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext>if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>l</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mi>L</mi></munderover><msub><mi>n</mi><mi>l</mi></msub></mrow></mrow><mo>≠</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mi>M</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo></msup></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="right"><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext>if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>l</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mi>L</mi></munderover><msub><mi>n</mi><mi>l</mi></msub></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mi>M</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo></msup></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mrow></math>
